name: implied
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
if something is implied, it is understood to be true or to exist, although it is not stated directly or in a legal agreement: an implied agreement/contract/licence Some judges are of the opinion that there must be an express or implied agreement between the parties before the defence can operate.implied duty/obligation/responsibility There is an implied duty upon partners to exercise reasonable care in the performance of their duties. Compare
express adjective
impliedly adverb
It is presumed that costs have been reasonable in amount, if their amount was expressly or impliedly approved by the client.
